data.Title: Google Declared a Monopoly in US Antitrust Case
data.Description: A US federal judge ruled that Google is a monopoly and has acted as one to maintain its dominance in the search market. The ruling could have significant implications for the company, potentially leading to limitations or a breakup.

data.Title: Apple Refuses to Replace Google with Bing, Even for "the Whole Company"
data.Description: Apple has rejected Microsoft's offer to replace Google with Bing as the default search engine on Safari, even if Microsoft offered the entire company. Apple cites Bing's poor quality and lack of revenue potential as reasons for sticking with Google.

data.Title: Google Search Ranking Volatility Increases
data.Description: Google Search ranking volatility is heating up again after a brief period of relative calm. This follows a period of significant volatility and coincides with the recent antitrust ruling against Google, although the two are not necessarily related.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Performance Report No Longer Shows Call Data
data.Description: The Google Business Profiles performance report is no longer displaying the "call" tab, which provided data on calls generated from Google Search and Maps. This change may be related to the recent removal of the Google Business Profile call history feature.

data.Title: Google Ads to Transition Smart Campaigns to Performance Max
data.Description: Google Ads will be transitioning the functionality of Smart Campaigns into Performance Max campaigns over the coming months. Google claims that Performance Max offers all the benefits of Smart Campaigns and more.

data.Title: Google Search Console Introduces New Recommendations Feature
data.Description: Google Search Console is rolling out a new feature called "Recommendations." This experimental feature provides website owners with personalized suggestions for improving their site's performance in Google Search, based on data from Search Console.
